sense.def:
To kick someone or something
pomeni nekoga udariti s stopalom.

seg.quote: He protested violently, and threatened to kick me.
We caught sight of Christopher, kicking a tin can down the High Street.
He gave him a good kick.

sense.def:
To kick
pomeni silovito in nenadoma premikati stopala, na primer pri plesu ali plavanju.

seg.quote: Simon was floating in the water and kicking with his feet.
They loved debate, and got a kick out of court proceedings.

sense.def:
To kick a habit
pomeni prenehati z neko navado;

seg.quote: Leicester's supporters have never kicked the travelling habit.

sense.def:
To kick off an event or a discussion
pomeni začeti neki dogodek ali pogovor;

seg.quote: They kicked off a two-month tour of the U.S. with a party in Washington.

sense.def:
To kick someone out
pomeni nekoga prisiliti, da zapusti neki kraj;

seg.quote: She kicked me out of the room.

sense.def:
To kick up a fuss or a row
pomeni postati zelo jezen ali vznemirjen;

seg.quote: When I told him, he kicked up a fuss.
